website_summaries.verdict: We love the versatility built into this outstanding calculator, which makes fast work of the most complex computations.
pros: There are an incredible 250 built-in functions and a 2-line display that's easy to read with convenient menus and prompts
Able to perform the most difficult statistical and mathematical analyses
Clicking buttons are a cut above
cons: May be too much for some users in function and price

customer_reviews.title: Great but seriously flawed.
customer_reviews.text: Updated review --> calculator works well, it is an upgrade when compared to the hp 12c. However, if you press the buttons to quickly they will almost always miss the first button press. Very disappointed, I have an older one (1980s) and this does not happen with it. I would recommend getting the HP 12c as it will work every single time. No I would not recommend this product. Orginal review --> Fantastic calculator! A good upgrade from the HP12c. TVM calculations are faster on the hp12c, but the solver feature is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: NOT English Language
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to upgrade from the 17BII and 17BII+ (Gold model) models to this "Silver Model. Everything is written in Spanish. Sorry, but I only know Russian, Japanese, and Greek. Not happy with this machine. Even the PDF Manual is only in Spanish. If I had known that this was the case, I would NOT have purchased this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Reva in SoCal

customer_reviews.title: Key misses and/or Processor is too slow
customer_reviews.text: This new 17BII+ has been an incredible disappointment. I have used HP calculators for the last 27 years, mainly because of Reverse Polish Notation. They (old school 17Bs and 12Cs) were great. The new one is either slow to recognize pushed keys or frequently completely misses key entry. When you pay a premium price, you expect a premium product. This one falls woefully short. HP has obviously gone cheap in their manufacturing practices. I thought it might just be me, but checked with my brother (bought him a 17BII as a gift), and he and a work colleague who has the same HP calculator have the same problem. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: EricM

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the older model
customer_reviews.text: My old HP 17B, which was almost 20 years old, stopped working so I had to buy a replacement. This new one doesn't seem to work as well. It has exact same features, but the keys aren't as responsible. On my old one, I used to be able to punch the keys as fast as I could and every number/function would register, but this one seems to keep skipping the first button. I have to go much slower and make sure each number is entered. Also, the buttons feel different when pressed. I've had this model since 10/14 and it hasn't improved with use. Might have to look at getting the old one fixed, if that's possible.
customer_reviews.author: jkmfromla

customer_reviews.title: Great Calculator
customer_reviews.text: Found it is a good investment to read the Guide and then the Manual as needed. Getting good use out of this calculator. I use it for general calculation (arithmetic) because it is fast in RPN mode and flexible for any type of chain calculations involving many terms. I also use it's time value of money (Loan calculations) and will be using it for cash flow / net present value for any type of investment i.e. long-term cash flow analysis. It is light weight, very responsive, and a good tool.
customer_reviews.author: JJL

customer_reviews.title: CFP® Calculator without RPN
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a replacement to an HP17 that had lasted a decade. I love having the option (rather than requirement) of using RPN. Working algebraically is natural, and makes this the obvious financial calculator choice for me
customer_reviews.author: larz

customer_reviews.title: avoid this calculator
customer_reviews.text: i'm a long-time hp calculator user (28S, 17BII, 12C). this particular calculator (17BII+ silver) has a major problem. it misses keystrokes. i used the previous version (17BII) without a hitch for over 20 years but this current one misses keystrokes, resulting in either using a wrong result or having to re-type in the entire equation again. to save yourself problems, just avoid this calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Garbage In Garbage Out - what a shame for an otherwise good calculator
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line is the keyboard can not be trusted. This sinks an otherwise great product. Erroneous entries or unregistered keys leaves you constantly wondering if you can trust your calculations. This is especially insidious with functions keys that can't be verified by the display. My unit had one issue of missing multiplication entries in about one out of six tries. I can't understand why I can buy a $3 no-name-calculator from a discount store which has completely reliable keyboard while this high end $100 model seems to be plagued with keyboard issues. I would love to own this calculator (returning the unit) if only the manufacturer could follow through on the basics.
customer_reviews.author: Rastro

customer_reviews.title: Not a Fan...
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up to use with some economics and finance classes I am taking. My professors specifically required a financial calculator or I would have used my trusty TI-89. I did some research before buying and bought this for the advanced feature set. I wasn't a fan of the menu layout and logic for entering functions. Maybe the time spent with my TI-89 has warped my thinking. Either way, it didn't seem natural for me. Ultimately, the reason I am returning is the keys do not always respond properly. It's extremely frustrating! I plan to replace with a TI financial calculator in hopes the keys work better and the menu system (logic) is a better fit for me.
customer_reviews.author: leffinger

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, the 17BII+ had some tricks up its sleeve ...
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this calculator specially because I already owned a TI BA II Plus Professional which was half the price. Fortunately, the 17BII+ had some tricks up its sleeve such as the RPN which is amazing and the ability to input your own formulas. I would recommend buying this calculator only if you actually need to use the programming function, which was my case. I continue to use both calculators, the TI for Cash flows and TMV problems and the HP for complex bond valuation which require your own formulas.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Rainman

customer_reviews.title: Get this one.
customer_reviews.text: I used to work as an analyst for a major investment house, and this was the calculator I used. It has a menu structure that allows you to make your choices in a straightforward way, instead of the cryptic methods of the HP 10B2, for instance. Also, this calculator has full bond support, even good enough for professional use. I would strongly suggest this calculator over any other on the market if you are doing anything remotely financial.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: HP 17B; first keystroke
customer_reviews.text: I used a 17B for years and loved it, but eventually it just died and had to replace it (in 2017) It was obvious the new version had changes that didn't make it as user friendly but it was still usable. The biggest problem was that the first keystroke would often miss and not register on the display. That is extremely frustrating when you are entering numbers very quickly and then have to start over. Now i'm looking for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: blueshoes32

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my finance class!
customer_reviews.text: This product was a requirement for my finance class. It arrived on time and it was in great condition. I've had it for about 6 months now and I haven't had any problems with it. I like the fact that it came with its own case because I don't have to worry about it getting little scratches on it. I would definitely recommend this product because it works great and I got it for half the price that my school's bookstore was selling it for.
customer_reviews.author: Winema Poti

customer_reviews.title: HP 17bii+ Silver now the best financial calculatorthe
customer_reviews.text: This is currently the finest HP business and general purpose calculator made. The silver version corrects the durability issues of the prior brown and gold version. The keypad and enclosure have been dramatically improved and is on par or better than the original "Pioneer" HP 17bii. The calculator is far better now than the 12c. The key feature is the HP Solve application that allows for algebraic entry of equations and solving for any arbitrary variable. Calculations are fast and the menu system allows for straightforward entry of variables without having to "R/S" programs. The 17bii+ silver version now has all the bases covered in regards to functionality, usability and durability.
customer_reviews.author: JoeyC

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly, no problems. Had to change the battery 9 months later of everyday use. Either way they're some others that cover the basic functions more effectively. The keys are a little bit stiff but for any basic finance studies it is good.
customer_reviews.author: Ana R.

customer_reviews.title: hP 17BII
customer_reviews.text: I've used all the different HP financial calculators for over 30 years now. My first 12C still looks and works like new. The 17BII is a sturdy option if you need a full featured financial calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Successor to the 19BII and 12C
customer_reviews.text: I've used two HP calculators over the last 23 years; the 19BII and 12C. The 17BII+ is functionally similar to the 19BII, but much more compact, with better keys and build quality. It doesn't have unit conversions, which were quite useful on the 19B. Also, the 19BII had a very handy four line display that is missing from the 17B. Some users lament the build quality of the 17B, and believe that it is not up to the standards of the older 12C. I understand the complaint, but believe that the plastic 17B is actually more durable than the 12C, and the design and functionality is far superior. Overall, I like this calculator alot.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey R. Elver

customer_reviews.title: World's Best Financial Calculator!
customer_reviews.text: The HP 17BII+ is simply the best financial calculator on the Market! Incredibly fast, versatile and powerful as well as being fully programmable to create your own custom equations - nothing else can compare. Even has built in quartz clock with complete time and date calculations menus. Also statistical analysis, advanced math calculations and of course extensive mortgage calculations. Plus, one of the few calculators with "RPN" mode: once you learn "Reverse Polish Notation" you will never go back! This baby is in a class by itself!
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment !
customer_reviews.text: Loved the original. Build quality of the new model is terrible. Keys do not work consistently. Have to watch screen to make sure every input is properly registering. A huge waste of time. HP should really fix this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great except for the keys
customer_reviews.text: Solid performance but not as good as my old HP 17b. Keys are 12C style, I prefer the original smooth keys. Sometimes the keys don’t respond and I get a miscalculation. Works well otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Geoff

customer_reviews.title: Useless Calculator
customer_reviews.text: I owned an original 17BII for at least 10 years and used daily --absolutely loved the original. I bought this new version of the 17BII several months ago and it is garbage. The keys don't operate as the original did. You need to work slowly and press the keys very carefully to have them register correctly. This is very annoying and time consuming. I though I might get accustomed to this over time and have been trying to use for several months now --there is no use. This calculator is useless for anyone that wants accurate numbers.
customer_reviews.author: JasonJ

customer_reviews.title: Great financial calculator
customer_reviews.text: Using this calculator to study for the CFP exam. Easy to operate and understand the functions. The second line on the screen really makes everything obvious and the buttons have a solid feel that speaks to the high quality construction.
customer_reviews.author: John F

customer_reviews.title: for financial calculations its the best model for the price
customer_reviews.text: The calculator is easy to learn how to use and as a bond investor its indispensable. Checking the YTM is easy and fast. Also keeping up with your investments percentage gains and losses is very accessible. There are so many uses for the calculator that its a must have,
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Angard

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at all.
customer_reviews.text: This used calculator doesn't work at all. Dead on arrival. Tried new batteries and still dead. Returning it and buying a new one.
customer_reviews.author: D. Blum

customer_reviews.title: I was expecting better financial functions
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting better financial functions. For example, it doesn't do Duration or Modified Duration for bond calculations. It does do things other calculators don't, but this was something that I thought should be there given that this is a higher-end financial calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Tom D

customer_reviews.title: great calculator
customer_reviews.text: If you go to SDSU this is the calculator you need for the business classes
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Clark

customer_reviews.title: HP 17BII+ Financial Calculator, Silver
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a gift for one of my nieces who was studying International Business. Also served as the "graduation present" because I didn't give her anything else during her final celebration. She leaves abroad and I don't trust the mail to send expensive things. She appreciate it very much because it was THE calculator that everyone in her class had to use.
customer_reviews.author: Yolita de Houston

customer_reviews.title: Keys not great
customer_reviews.text: I had read the other reviews mentioning the keys, but this seemed like the best calculator for my accounting program. Functionally, the calculator is just what I had hoped for. However, I agree that the keys are terrible. I will most likely go get an older used 17Bii to replace this. I should note that, at the time I purchased it, Amazon is selling this for half the price of any competitor. That does cushion the disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick P

customer_reviews.title: Build quality down, but a good calculator. RPN or ALG.
customer_reviews.text: I miss the solid feel of the old HP calculators. My previous one (same or similar model) was made in the US. This is made in China and feels cheaper. You can choose either RPN (my preference) or algebraic mode. This uses two 2032 batteries (which you can get online for less than $1 apiece). Over the course of a year, I've had to replace batteries once.
customer_reviews.author: N Gogol

customer_reviews.title: Best financial calculator out there!
customer_reviews.text: Best ever. May have to get used to it but wouldn’t be without it!
customer_reviews.author: crissy h. georgelas

customer_reviews.title: Eats batteries. Only 3-6 months of very light use per set of batteries.
customer_reviews.text: I am told I can remove the batteries and reinstall them before each use or disable the clock to get around this. I will likely remove the batteries and leave it in a desk drawer and replace it with a more reliable calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Mike NH

customer_reviews.title: but I especially love the solver function where you can write your own ...
customer_reviews.text: I got my first HP 17B at a computer store as a door prize in 1987 and it lasted me 27 years before it gave up a year ago. There are a number of commonly used business and financial functions available, but I especially love the solver function where you can write your own algebraic equations to input variables into. Great calculator!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Very good calculator
customer_reviews.text: After my HP 17bII was knocked off a counter and killed the screen I looked to replace it. I soon found the 17bII+ and ordered from Amazon. After reading some of the reviews I was a little concerned but mine works just fine. It does not convey the same feel of quality as earlier HPs. It just seems lighter and less solid. The keys have good feel but don't match the feel of the many earlier HPs I have owned. However, it gets the job done, and may last as long as the earlier models, but if you are looking for the HP "feel" you may be disappointed. The case however is a great improvement over the 17bII.
customer_reviews.author: Kodachrome man

customer_reviews.title: the display will have a dark patch in the middle like my 17BII
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was very fast. The calculator is similar to the 17BII I have, but with bigger memory. I just wonder if, after some times, the display will have a dark patch in the middle like my 17BII.
customer_reviews.author: Chen Namchaisiri

customer_reviews.title: I'm not done testing it out yet but I wanted ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not done testing it out yet but I wanted to note that the packaging I got was all in SPANISH!!! The DVD is multi-lingual as is the calculator. The manual, unfortunately, is only in Spanish, which I do not speak or read. However, I am familiar with this calculator (I have an older version) so I should be okay for the tasks I already know. I will need to find an English manual online for the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Jo L

customer_reviews.title: Received in defective condition
customer_reviews.text: The product I received was defective. The decimal point button takes extreme effort to enable. I need to return this, but my return window has passed. What are my options now Alexa?
customer_reviews.author: GREGG CULLINGS

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for my 20 year old HP 17BII
customer_reviews.text: After reading the comments hear I was very sad... It sounded like the new calculators were junk. I disagree. It is the same old functionality, perhaps it is not built to withstand a nuclear blast, but so what. Nobody uses these things to price bonds all day long, we do a little TVM. I purchased an old model (new) for about $40. Heck, the batteries are about $30 so no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Kimo

customer_reviews.title: Still a great product! The last one survived the college years
customer_reviews.text: Still a great product! The last one survived the college years, and several more at work, until the coffee cup incident...
customer_reviews.author: RJB-Denver

customer_reviews.title: Calculator couldn't even turn on, much less function.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this calculator for an3 upper division, highly intensive statistics classes. "New," calculator arrived with "fresh," batteries that failed to even turn the calculator on. After purchasing a new set of batteries, the calculator died after 2 minutes of use. Very inconvenient as I needed the calculator for all 3 classes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Calculator looks brand new. However, no more battery once I used it for 3 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Trang Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: but this is a great calculator at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I would not call this the highest quality hp, especially if you compare to the old models in terms of build quality and key entry, but this is a great calculator at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Jaws Revenge

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality. Doesn't feel as solid in one's hand ...
customer_reviews.text: Great functionality. Doesn't feel as solid in one's hand as it's predecessor.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Keys Not Responsive
customer_reviews.text: I had a older version which I loved and used almost everyday for over 10 years before it finally broke. With this new calculator, I always have to double check because some times the keys are not responsive when pressed. Now I rarely use it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Russ T.

customer_reviews.title: Good calculator, in spanish, without a manual.
customer_reviews.text: Came set in Spanish, did not include the nice HP printed manuals you might be used to if you've purchased HP calculators before. If you're buying this for someone else (as I was as a replacement for my father's 17BII,) you might want to re-think having it drop shipped there without first configuring it (and printing the ~300pg manual.)
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Great financial calculator
customer_reviews.text: The best financial calculator ever created. Even that is an old model it is easy to use and has all the financial functions for anyone who works in finance. Its great that HP is still making them.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Financial calculator
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older 17 BII which finally gave out after many years of use. It is an excellent calculator and can be as complex or simple as you need. The new version has a few more bells and whistles but is essentially the same as the older model.
customer_reviews.author: Iliad

customer_reviews.title: ) The features are easy enough to access
customer_reviews.text: The [HP-17b II+] is a Superiority Financial Calculator (like a well aged McDonnell Douglas F-15E.) The features are easy enough to access, clearly marked at the buttons, and not cluttered like the other financial calculators. Wanted a practical and not intimidating financial calculator. There were always good financial calculators from the 1990s, example HP-19b II+ which was the Supreme Financial Calculator that my Sister has. That HP-19b II+ was impressive and daunting to learn. Now with this new (okay, HP product was introduced back in A.D.2003) HP-17b II+ is actually better manufactured--- pray it lasts as long as the HP-19b II+. Not a finance major, but is easy to learn. This should be "duck soup" for most folks.
customer_reviews.author: Viper Pilot

customer_reviews.title: My Right Hand
customer_reviews.text: I've used HP 17's for 30 years (or so). It's been my right hand financial calculator as a Licensed Real Estate Broker in New Mexico. Retired now, but I still use for personal financial planning, helping out family and friends and in other financial investments. It's the best and friendliest financial calculator I've owned (out of the other 4 or 5). I find it the most useful in calculating and comparing mortgage rates, 10. 15 & 30 year differing interest rates and payments for such mortgages, etc. Recommend a definite BUY if you are in the market for a financial calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Apostalon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great financial calculator, 2 line screen for a hand held is pretty unusual.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey L

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat the price glad the model is still available
customer_reviews.text: Cant beat the price glad the model is still available!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda L Loula

customer_reviews.title: The new version is great!
customer_reviews.text: I had serious reservations about buying this calculator because of the negative reviews of its predecessor. Forget those negative reviews. This one rocks. The buttons are tactile and work every time, the display is big and bright, unlike the previous 17B I own, and the functions are the best you can buy in financial calculators.
customer_reviews.author: Derral F

customer_reviews.title: Financial Calculator
customer_reviews.text: The calculator was just as described. I am happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Kim W.

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my 17B
customer_reviews.text: The function keys were beginning to stick on my HP17B. This model works the same way. I hope it lasts as many years as my old 17B as I use Utah daily to price leases for my work.
customer_reviews.author: W. C. Hadgigeorge

customer_reviews.title: Find something else but not a HP 17bII+
customer_reviews.text: Once a proud owner of a 19BII this is about as close as you get as a replacement. It is not worth the money. The buttons work poorly so you must exercise extreme care when keyboarding or you will have input errors. Today the display cracked not due to abuse but the clasp for the case hits right where the display broke. HP will not replace this calculator because they consider this abuse or customer damage versus a poorly thought out design. I am going to try TI after this disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: M. TIBOR

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I used the 12C for years and finally needed to replace it. I first tried the TI BA II and was very disappointed. So I bought the HP 17bII+ and have been very satisfied. The keys make the subtle click when pressed so I know the number has been entered. I also like how it can be used in both the RPL and Algebredic modes. What really sold me though is the straightforward ease of using the financial functions for calculating loans and other finance activities. It's light-years ahead of other calculators in the less than $100 price point.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J Delaney

customer_reviews.title: HP 17bII+ improvement
customer_reviews.text: This new version of the 17bII+ is an improvement from the previous 17bII+. HP improved the buttons and increased the size of the Input button. This is the 4th HP calculator I've purchased. I'd recommend it (has the appearence of the 12C Platinum). Don't buy the 17bII+ with the smaller Input button. The buttons are of poor quality (I have one & don't use it). All said, the old 17bII is the best version, if you can find on web. Best buttons & quality. This is the best financial calculator on the market.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tipton

customer_reviews.title: Nice calculator, does its job
customer_reviews.text: The calculator does what it's supposed to. It's not super fancy and does not have exciting graphics. But once you play around with it for a while, the interface is somewhat intuitive. It also returns results fairly quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Khosravi

customer_reviews.title: Best financial calculator
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt, you cannot get a better calculator. It's very intuitive and easy to use. You just have to remember to hit the clear all button a lot. Other than that, I find it much easier to use, with the menus, than finding buttons on the 12c's. Well worth the extra price.
customer_reviews.author: Tenchi

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator!
customer_reviews.text: Product has been working great. It came in great condition, practically new. I’m very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Double check if it comes with the listed items
customer_reviews.text: I was supposed to receive batteries with this and did not, price should reflect what is actually included.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: No complaints & RPN capability is great!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this calculator for about 4 months and have found it to be very intuitive and easy to use. I purchased it for a finance class and use it mostly for TVM and cash flow analysis calculations. I use RPN mode exclusively and love that it had this capability. I have not experienced the button push issues others have noted. Thank you for a great product, HP!
customer_reviews.author: iamshoeman

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I owned the HP 19B II for many years and was very happy with it. I am disappointed with the HP 17BII+ as the quality is much lower. Several of the keys don't work very well so I frequently enter incorrect amounts. You are better off trying to buy a used HP calculator than wasting money on junky products like the 17BII+.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel in San Diego

customer_reviews.title: Never worked - faulty product
customer_reviews.text: The product never worked. I tried everything and the calculator never started. Frustrating
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Badessich

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but instructions don't come in English, had to look them up online.
customer_reviews.author: Laju Obasaju

customer_reviews.title: Great Calculator
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a 17BII at University and I love it. This looks cheaper and less resistant than the older version but it has the same functions (and more). I got this with a great discount from amazon at just US45
customer_reviews.author: Juan Enciso

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME CALCULATOR
customer_reviews.text: This is an AWESOME financial calculator. I almost gave it five stars but you can never be perfect. As a novice to finance calculators I found this one very easy to learn and use. If you're looking for a business calculator this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: JSP

customer_reviews.title: the product does not work and there is no support
customer_reviews.text: the fact that it stopped working and there is no one to talk to re repairs or help
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Daniel Rinaldi

customer_reviews.title: Has all the functions I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my last HP Business calculator in 1977. Lasted a long time. corroded batteries did it in! This one is better and will most likely outlive me!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Nice packaging, nice and easy way to store formulas, i just find it amazing for finances class, and most important, many people have it, so its way easier for someone to explain to you how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: tiko.col

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like it, but it was not made to like me.
customer_reviews.text: I found this calculator very tedious and frustrating to use. Especially for floating point calculations.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: great calculator
customer_reviews.text: nice financial calculator, very easy to use once you get the hang of it. If you are in the accounting, financial planning world, you need a good calculator.
customer_reviews.author: golfguy

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a 30 year old HP 17 Financial Calculator. Hope this one lasts as long.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great Calculator
customer_reviews.text: The included manual didn't really help me get off the ground as quickly as I hoped. There is a more detailed manual available online and I found it to be somewhat cumbersome but the information is there for people to find what they need to do the calculations.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Johnson

customer_reviews.title: HP 17bII+ fills the bill
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a replacement for my 12c for a long time. The 17BII+ is far easier to use and has a much improved display. I one feature it lacks that I would like is a USB port for use in uploading tables and downloading formulas. For the price it is a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Pardue

customer_reviews.title: Tops calculator.
customer_reviews.text: This a replacement for the one wich was stolen by a fellow student in the MBA course. It was a question of brands: that or Texas Instrument's, I chose to return to my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Americus

customer_reviews.title: I Have Tried to Hate the 17BII+
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to hate the 17BII+, but I can not. After reading all of the negative reviews I was expecting my new calculator (17BII+) to be a complete failure. The keys work great, and this model is faster and lighter than the 17BII that it replaced. The 17BII+ does not have the solid feel that my previous HP calculators (17BII & 12C) had. The 12C was bought in the 80's for college and the 17BII in the 90's for graduate school. The 12C still works. If the 17BII+ does let me down I will submit an entry titled "I Have Tried to Hate the 17BII+ Part 2".
customer_reviews.author: VA

customer_reviews.title: Good with Math
customer_reviews.text: Calculator is much better than I expected after reading other reviews about it. It might not weigh as much as the older HP's but button action is the best of the all the calculators I own and I like the logic of the button layout, much better than my BAII Plus. Wish I had bought this calculator first.
customer_reviews.author: Shortanswer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use, plenty of instructions with the pdf file available in the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Marcie N  Mock

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was on time and the product as advertised. Good service.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Juan Escudero

customer_reviews.title: RPN and HP Solve
customer_reviews.text: These aren't as good as the 19 BII model which I can no longer find but it does the job. I really love the HP Solve function and the RPN notation! !!!
customer_reviews.author: bob bondi

customer_reviews.title: keyboard problems
customer_reviews.text: i had an old hp28c that was a tank. i started my mba and thought it would be a good idea to upgrade to the latest top of the line hp business calculator. the 3 key registers about 1/4 of the time unless i really mash it. often as i am entering numbers quickly in sequence 3's randomly don't get picked up. i should have paid more attention to the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cameron DeHeer

customer_reviews.title: Quality of the product
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the product is very good. Deliver as promised. Good
customer_reviews.author: Daud Setiawan

customer_reviews.title: I'm bummed!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one since I lost my 17BII and am hugely DISAPPOINTED! Not only is the feel no longer solid, but the KEYS DON'T REGISTER THE ENTRY many times which means you have to continuously double check that the number was entered. UNACCEPTABLE! Reminds me of the TI scientific calculators that I bought in the early 1980's. Same problem and I'm sure this calculator will wind up in the same place. the Trash!!
customer_reviews.author: wrkhrdplahrd

customer_reviews.title: Works great - Thank you - I owned a HP17B that ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great - Thank you - I owned a HP17B that I use everyday for the past 20 years Spanish instruction did come with the calculator; however, just download the English version as a PDF.
customer_reviews.author: Darin W.

customer_reviews.title: Calc
customer_reviews.text: Beyond satisfied with this calculator. It works and is exactly like the old one I used to have. Beyond happy I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Gleixner

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like
customer_reviews.text: The display is good, the keyboard is good, and it will still do RPN!
customer_reviews.author: Donald Braun

customer_reviews.title: Just as described at a GREAT! price.
customer_reviews.text: Need to replace my old 17B. They are not to be found so I bought this 17BII+. Virtually the same and this one was at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Barney415

customer_reviews.title: It was cheaper becouse it's in Spanish
customer_reviews.text: Manual was in Spanish, but it's realy no big deal becouse the calculator has language settings and I got an English manual online
customer_reviews.author: Dkluger

customer_reviews.title: ... CFP exam and I think this calc is so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Used it to take the CFP exam and I think this calc is so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. The only problem is that you have to make sure that you really press each key or it may not pick up on it. This calculator comes with the batteries included and a great case too!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth tranchina

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I've used HP calculators for years, and they have always been great. This is my second 17B, and the first one lasted for years.
customer_reviews.author: mjkwpb

customer_reviews.title: not bad
customer_reviews.text: pretty good as far as financial calculators go although i still don't know how to do everything on it
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Decent replacement for my 19bii
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for my old hp. Fairly well made and I am happy with it. I typically use the basic math and finance functions and this fits the bill well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C. Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this calculator for my graduate level finance course at the recommendation of my professor, and it worked great! This calculator met all of my needs and it's a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Caton

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: The best Financial Calculator, easy to understand the functions, I owed a HP 19BII, almost the same functions but this one is smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Rodolfo Manuel Ochoa Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: School
customer_reviews.text: It served its purpose in school but now calculators are available as an app on your phone. Hefty price tag gone...
customer_reviews.author: S. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this calculator for a financial class but I am loving it because it makes it so easy to calculate finances. Now I can easily calculate how much money I should be saving to accumulate a certain amount by a given time. Arrived quickly also!
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Summers

customer_reviews.title: Only Spanish instuctions?
customer_reviews.text: Received the calculator one day early... that was awesome! The only complaint is the calculator was packaged with only Spanish instructions and package labels... that was somewhat annoying.
customer_reviews.author: chuey

customer_reviews.title: Great financial calculator, haven't learned all the tricks yet.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is one of the best financial calculators out there. I have not used it extensively but have been pleased with the functions that I have learned.
customer_reviews.author: StormScholar

customer_reviews.title: The closest product to HP19BII
customer_reviews.text: First of all let me say that I owned an HP 19BII+ for over 16 years, what a great financial calculator, I will miss it. I have to say that the 17BII+ is also a great product, very well built, just as you expect from HP, I really do not understand earlier complaints about lower quality issues. I gave it 4 stars just because the 17 does not have the valuable unit conversion that the 19B had, otherwise it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Angel Cubias

product_meta.title: HP 17BII+ Financial Calculator, Silver
product_meta.description:
For students and professionals in real estate, finance, accounting and business. The HP 17bII+ financial calculator is both powerful and easy-to-use. Quickly calculate loan payments, interest rates and conversions, standard deviation, percent, TVM, NPV, IRR, cash flows, bonds and more. Features 28KB of user memory, over 250 functions, RPN and Algebraic data entry, clock, appointments, calendar, HP solve application, menus prompts and messages.

AMAZON.COM
Designed with real-estate, business, and finance professionals in mind, the HP 17bII+ financial calculator provides RPN or algebraic data-entry modes and over 250 easy-to-use functions. Its two-line, 22-character display is easy to read, offering convenient menus and prompts, plus clock and calendar. 

 Free Online Training
Make the most of your HP calculator with free online training. First, visit http://www.hp.com/calculators/educators.html for Learning Modules, which are online self-paced training lessons that you control. Second, visit http://www.hp.com/calculators/training/virtual_classroom.html to register for Virtual Courses that are conducted by experienced instructors who can answer your questions. Third, click below to take an interactive Product Tour and learn about the rich features this calculator offers. 

Getting down to business, the 17bII+ provides TMV and amortization features plus list-based, cash-flow analysis, currency conversions, depreciation and percentage calculations, interest rate conversions, bond price and yield calculations, and more. Statistical/mathematical features include correlation forecasting (linear, logarithmic, exponential, and power) and deviation calculations, just to name a few. 

 The HP 17bII+ financial calculator has a built-in memory of 28K and power-off memory protection. It offers your choice of German, French, English, Spanish, Italian, or Portuguese language operation and a one-year warranty. 

 What's in the Box
Calculator, batteries, user guide, leather carrying case, instructions, warranty information
